name: Ability Capsule
description: Changes one of a Pokémon’s Abilities to the user’s choice within the same slot.

name: Absorb Bulb
description: An energy-storing shoot. Used up if the holder is hit by a Water Move to Boost SATK by +5.

name: Adrenaline Orb
description: Used up when the holder is affected by Intimidate, Startle, or Chill to Boost SPE by +5. Can be used as an item to make wild Pokémon call for help.

name: Air Balloon
description: The holder floats in the air (Immune to terrain, grounded entry hazards, and Ground-Type damage) until damaged by a Move, which pops the Air Balloon.

name: Antidote
description: Cures Poison. A spraybottle of antitoxin.

name: Apricorn
description: The historical main ingredient for Pokémon capture. Use with a Ball Kit during a Rest to ignore one of the crafted Balls’ ₽ cost.

name: Assault Bracers
description: Anti-ballistic armor that Boosts the holder's DEF by +10, but they can’t use Status Moves.

name: Assault Vest
description: Anti-projectile armor that Boosts the holder's SDEF by +10, but they can’t use Status Moves.

name: Awakening
description: Cures Sleep. A spraybottle of mint and caffeine.

name: Ball Kit
description: Can craft any type of Poké Ball but Master Ball during Rests by spending 1.5× cost of the Ball. Can't capture new friends without them.

name: Pass Baton
description: Used up if the holder switches out, transferring effects as if the holder used Baton Pass.

name: Battle Kit
description: Can craft X-Items during Rests by spending 1.5× cost of the item. A good pick-me-up always helps.

name: Beast Ball
description: +6 to capture Ultra Beasts, but −6 to capture anything else.

name: Berry Juice
description: Heals 20 HP. Eaten if the holder drops below half HP. 100% pure juice.

name: Berry Kit
description: Can spend 1.5× their buying price to craft Berries during a Rest. Plant hybridization for kids!

name: Berry Planter
description: A miniature hothouse for gardening on the go. Each planter duplicates 1 berry per Long Rest.

name: Berry Sweet
description: If the holder's HP falls below 3 Ticks, they eat the Sweet to get +3 Critical Rate.

name: Bicycle
description: The fastest way to travel by human power. Every kid wants one. For 2000₽ more, it can inflate its tires to travel over calm water.

name: Big Root
description: The holder's Draining Moves and Strength Sap heal twice as much, and Leech Seed/Ingrain/Aqua Ring heals them +1 Tick.

name: Big Treasure
description: Golden Oscars, comet shards, pearl strings… Treasure that’ll make you rich.

name: Binding Band
description: An industrial-strength rubber Möbius strip. The holder's Binding Moves inflict an extra +5 of HP loss between rounds.

name: Binoculars
description: Lets you see practically from one end of a route to the other.

name: Black Augurite
description: A glassy, sharp rock that can be used up to evolve Scyther.

name: Black Belt
description: Pulls tight around the holder to give their Fighting Moves +5 damage.

name: Black Flute
description: Toots a foreboding doot. The next wild Pokémon encountered gets 2 Levels stronger.

name: Black Glasses
description: The holder's Dark Moves get +5 damage. Disguises one’s intentions.

name: Black Sludge
description: Poison-Types holding it heal 1 Tick between rounds, but others lose 1 Tick. A blob of gross goop.

name: Blue Flute
description: Trills a shrill note that awakens a character of your choice.

name: Blunder Policy
description: If the holder misses a Move, they consume Blunder Policy to Boost +10 SPE. Inaccuracy insurance.

name: Bounce Shield
description: Whenever a character hits the holder with a Ranged Move, they lose 1 Tick of HP.

name: Bright Powder
description: The holder gets +2 Evasion from its glittery glare.

name: Burn Heal
description: Cures Burn. A spraybottle of aloe and liquid bandage.

name: Calcium
description: Stat Booster. Gives +1 to the user's Focus and Composure, but they no longer gain gain skill bonuses at Level 20. Consuming other Stat Booster items stacks at 1 level lower for each.

name: Carbos
description: Stat Booster. Gives +1 to the user's Acrobatics and Deception, but they no longer gain gain skill bonuses at Level 20. Consuming other Stat Booster items stacks at 1 level lower for each.

name: Carrot
description: Restores Accuracy Rate to +0. Can be used as an ingredient for Chef meals.

name: Celery
description: Restores Evasion to +0. Can be used as an ingredient for Chef meals.

name: Cell Battery
description: Used up when the holder is hit by an Electric Move, Boosting ATK by +5. A rechargeable AA.

name: Charcoal
description: The holder's Fire Moves get +5 damage. Cinder used as tinder.

name: Choice Band
description: The holder gets +10 ATK, but can only repeat the first Move they used until they leave the battle. A headband for stubbornness.

name: Choice Scarf
description: The holder gets +10 SPE, but can only repeat the first Move they used until they leave the battle. An accessory to impulse.

name: Choice Specs
description: The holder gets +10 SATK, but can only repeat the first Move they used until they leave the battle. Glasses that cause shortsightedness.

name: Clover Sweet
description: If the holder's HP falls below 3 Ticks, the holder eats the Sweet to get +3 Evasion.

name: Cooking Pot
description: A campfire cauldron for the whole party! During a Rest, each Trainer consumes one berry to restore 3 PP and get +3 Max PP until their next Rest.

name: Dawn Stone
description: Catches the light like a sudden realization. Can be used up to evolve Eevee, Snorunt♀, or Kirlia♂.

name: Deep Sea Scale
description: A faint pink fishscale that can be used up to evolve Clamperl into Gorebyss. Clamperl holding this item also get +10 Stealth.

name: Deep Sea Tooth
description: A sharp silver fang that can be used up to evolve Clamperl into Huntail. Clamperl holding this item also get +10 Focus.

name: Destiny Knot
description: If a character Infatuates the holder, they also become Infatuated with the holder. A red thread fated to bind lovers.

name: Dire Hit
description: Boosts Critical Rate by +4. Pharmaceutical trademarked as Criticut.

name: Dive Ball
description: +6 to capture Pokémon that live underwater.

name: Dowsing Machine
description: Trainers holding this gain the Pickup Ability. A short-range item finder.

name: Dragon Fang
description: An ancient’s tooth that gives the holder's Dragon Moves +5 damage.

name: Dragon Scale
description: A thick, unyielding scale that can be used up to evolve Seadra.

name: Dream Ball
description: +6 to capture sleeping targets.

name: Dubious Disc
description: Can be used up to evolve Porygon2. They didn't enhance the user experience enough…

name: Dusk Ball
description: +6 to capture when dark, such as at night or in caves.

name: Dusk Stone
description: Swallows light that tries to shine through it. Can be used up to evolve Eevee, Misdreavus, Murkrow, Lampent, or Doublade.

name: Dynamax Band
description: Trainers wearing this can Dynamax and Gigantamax their Pokémon. A Wishing Star set into Galarian battle jewelry.

name: Eject Button
description: When a Move damages the holder, they use up the Eject Button to switch out or flee 3 Zones. Press to release a giant spring.

name: Eject Pack
description: If any of the holder’s Stats Drop, they uses up Eject Pack to switch out or flee 3 Zones. Launches at the first sign of trouble.

name: Electric Seed
description: If the field is Electric Terrain, the holder eats Electric Seed to Boost DEF by +5.

name: Electirizer
description: An electricity-packed device that can be used up to evolve Electabuzz.

name: Elixir
description: Restores 6 PP. The best energy drink money can't buy.

name: Escape Rope
description: A Silph Co. product that looks like a regular rope, but will unwind away from gravity through any holes to the surface. Usually not allowed indoors.

name: Ether
description: Restores 3 PP. The best energy drink money can buy.

name: Eviolite
description: Holders that haven't evolved yet get +5 DEF and SDEF. A mysterious lump that repurposes energy stored for evolution.

name: Expert Belt
description: The holder's super-effective Moves get +5 damage. A well-worn token from a battle master.

name: Fast Ball
description: +6 to capture Pokémon with 10 or higher base SPE, and can interrupt fleeing Pokémon for +6 to capture.

name: Fire Stone
description: Flickers like a burning ember. Can be used up to evolve Vulpix, Growlithe, Pansear, Capsakid, or Eevee.

name: Fishing Rod
description: Might hook a wild Pokémon. If it does, contest its Athletics to reel it in.

name: Flame Orb
description: Burns the holder between rounds. Barely hot enough that it seems fine for a little bit.

name: Flashlight
description: A solar-charged industrial flashlight. Almost never runs out of battery.

name: Float Stone
description: Halves the holder's weight. A pumice pebble much lighter than it looks.

name: Flower Sweet
description: If the holder's HP falls below 3 Ticks, they eat the Sweet to get +3 Effect Range.

name: Focus Band
description: If a damaging Move would KO the holder, they roll a DC 19 Save. On success, they endure with 1 HP instead. A headband for determination.

name: Focus Sash
description: If a damaging Move would Faint the holder from 100% HP, they endure with 1 HP instead. A wrap for overwhelming odds.

name: Fossil
description: Stony remnants of an ancient species. Bring to a scientist for restoration into a Pokémon.

name: Fairy Feather
description: The holder's Fairy Moves get +5 damage.

name: Fresh Water
description: Heals 30 HP.

name: Friend Ball
description: Pokémon kept in this ball always deal max damage when using Return.

name: Full Heal
description: Cures all Status Problems. A cure-all for common ailments.

name: Full Restore
description: Fully heals HP and cures all Status Problems. You get what you pay for.

name: Galarica Loop
description: A ring of woven-together Galarica twigs, wearable as a cuff or a wreath. Can be used up to evolve Galarian Slowpoke to Galarian Slowbro or Galarian Slowking (your choice).

name: Gem Kit
description: Can spend 1.5× their buying price to craft Type Gems, Type Plates, or Evolutionary Stones during Rests. Carving out a new hobby.

name: Safety Goggles
description: Dustproof eyewear that gives the holder Immunity to Weather damage and Moves with names containing “Powder” or “Spore”.

name: Gondola
description: A basket that holds an entire party. Has harnesses Pokémon can wear to carry the device. A hot-air balloon is 2000₽ extra.

name: Grassy Seed
description: If the field is Grassy Terrain, the holder eats Grassy Seed to Boost DEF by +5.

name: Great Ball
description: +2 to capture.

name: Grip Claw
description: The holder's Binding Moves last 2 rounds longer.

name: Guard Spec.
description: Acts like the Move Mist on the target. Pharmaceutical trademarked as Effect Guard.

name: Hard Stone
description: An unbreakable stone gives the holder's Rock Moves +5 damage.

name: Heal Ball
description: Fully heals the captured Pokémon.

name: Heart Prop
description: The holder heals 1 Tick whenever it uses a Move that targets Allies.

name: Heart Scale
description: A universal symbol of goodwill. Many accept it in exchange for a favor.

name: Heavy Ball
description: +6 to capture Pokémon that weigh 300 lbs or more.

name: Heavy-Duty Boots
description: The holder is immune to Hazards. Thick soles prevent terrestrial treachery.

name: Hyper Potion
description: Heals 120 HP. Industry-grade healing.

name: Ice Heal
description: Cures Frozen. A spraybottle of brine and char.

name: Ice Stone
description: Glints like a glacier. Can be used up to evolve Eevee, Crabrawler, Alolan Sandslash, Alolan Vulpix, Galarian Darumaka, or Cetoddle.

name: Iron
description: Stat Booster. Gives +1 to the user's Endurance and Bluster, but they no longer gain gain skill bonuses at Level 20. Consuming other Stat Booster items stacks at 1 level lower for each.

name: Iron Ball
description: Halves the holder’s SPE and grounds them. A heavy black iron sphere.

name: Key Stone
description: Trainers wearing this can use Mega Evolution. Battle jewelry from Kalos.

name: King's Rock
description: On 19+, the holder's attacks Flinch the target. A stone radiating a regal aura, that can be used up to evolve Slowpoke and Poliwhirl.

name: Leaf Stone
description: Always surrounded with fresh air. Can be used up to evolve Gloom, Weepinbell, Exeggcute, Eevee, Nuzleaf, or Pansage.

name: Leek
description: Doubles Farfetch'd’s or Sirfetch'd's Critical Rate when held. A mighty scallion.

name: Leftovers
description: The holder heals 1 Tick between Rounds.

name: Lemonade
description: Heals 70 HP.

name: Level Ball
description: Add the user's Level to the Capture Check and subtract the target's.

name: Life Orb
description: The holder's damaging Moves get +5 damage, but they lose a Tick of HP after using them. Symbolizes pyrrhic victory.

name: Light Ball
description: Pikachu gets +10 Intensity and Focus when held. Other holders are Paralyzed between rounds. Feels like pleasant tingling at first.

name: Light Clay
description: The holder's Reflect, Light Screen, or Aurora Veil lasts 2 rounds longer. Building material for wondrous walls of light.

name: Local Specialty
description: Heals 20 HP and cures all Status Problems. Rage Candy Bars, Old Gateaux, Sandwiches; everywhere’s got one.

name: Love Ball
description: +6 to capture Pokémon attracted to the Trainer’s active Pokémon.

name: Love Sweet
description: If the holder's HP falls below 3 Ticks, they eat the Sweet and get +3 to Save Bonus.

name: Luminous Moss
description: If the holder is damaged by a Water Move, is used up to Boost SDEF by +5. A green clump that glows when watered.

name: Lure Ball
description: +6 to capture Pokémon that were baited into the encounter.

name: Luxury Ball
description: Pokémon kept in this ball always deal max damage when using Return.

name: Magmarizer
description: A heat-packed device that can be used up to evolve Magmar.

name: Magnet
description: A powerful lodestone gives the holder's Electric Moves +5 damage.

name: Magnifying Glass
description: Ghost-Types are not Immune to the holder's Normal or Fighting Moves. Foreseen forensics.

name: Master Ball
description: Always catches a Pokémon without fail.

name: Max Ether
description: Restores all PP.

name: Max Honey
description: Cures Fainting and heals all HP.

name: Max Mushroom
description: Boosts ATK, DEF, SATK, SDEF, and SPE by +5 each. Wild Pokemon might Dynamax by eating these.

name: Max Potion
description: Heals all HP.

name: Max Revive
description: Cures Fainting and heals all HP. A clump of vitality.

name: Medical Kit
description: Can spend 1.5× their buying price to craft any non-Berry item that restores HP, PP, or Status during Rests. The best defense is a good bandage.

name: Medium Treasure
description: Gold nuggets, star pieces, big pearls, Amiibo. Treasure that’ll make you smile.

name: Mega Stone
description: Named after a single species (“Beedrillite”, “Dunsparcite”, etc.) Allows a matching holder to Mega Evolve.

name: Mental Herb
description: The holder consumes Mental Herb when inflicted with Infatuation, Taunt, Torment, Encore, or Disable to cure that status.

name: Metal Coat
description: A canister of metallic film that can be used up to evolve Onix or Scyther. The holder's Steel Moves get +5 damage.

name: Metronome
description: Each consecutive turn the holder hits with a damaging Move, that move gets +5 damage each future use until it misses, fails, or another Move is used. Max +20. Rewards rhythm.

name: Miracle Seed
description: A seed of life force gives the holder’s Grass Moves +5 damage.

name: Misty Seed
description: If the field is Misty Terrain, is eaten by the holder to Boost SDEF by +5.

name: Moomoo Milk
description: Heals 100 HP. Highly nutritious.

name: Moon Ball
description: +6 to capture Pokémon that evolve or evolved with a Moon Stone.

name: Moon Stone
description: Radiates X-Rays. Can be used up to evolve Nidorina, Nidoking, Jigglypuff, Clefairy, Eevee, Skitty, or Munna.

name: Muscle Band
description: The holder's Physical Moves get +5 damage. A strength-exuding headband.

name: Mystic Water
description: A tear-shaped gem gives the holder's Water Moves +5 damage.

name: Nature Mint
description: Each Mint has a Nature: Hardy, Adamant, etc. Pokémon can eat a Mint to ignore their Nature’s bonus and penalty to their battle stats and get Bonus Stats that affect their battle stats like the Mint’s Nature.

name: Nest Ball
description: +6 to capture if the target is Level 5 or lower.

name: Net Ball
description: +6 to capture if the target is Water- or Bug-Type.

name: Never-Melt Ice
description: A heat-repelling chunk gives the holder's Ice Moves +5 damage.

name: Oval Stone
description: An egg-shaped rock that can be used up to evolve Happini.

name: Paralyze Heal
description: Cures Paralysis. A squirtbottle of liniment.

name: Peat Block
description: A muddy turf cube that can be used up to evolve Ursaring.

name: Poffin
description: Boosts the next social skill check made by the Pokémon who eats it by +5. They don't stack.

name: Poffin Box
description: A baker’s dozen of Poffins. (That’s 13, to be clear.)

name: Poffin Plum
description: Can be used with a Berry Kit during a Rest to make a Poffin for free.

name: Poison Barb
description: The holder's Poison Moves get +5 damage.

name: Poké Ball
description: Throw at a Pokémon to try to capture them.

name: Poké Doll
description: Use to automatically flee from a wild Pokémon, or to decorate.

name: Poké Puff
description: Boosts the next physical skill check made by the Pokémon who eats it by +5.

name: Pokédex
description: A high-tech Pokémon encyclopedia. Some models are chatty.

name: Potion
description: Heals 20 HP. A spraybottle of first-aid ointment.

name: Power Herb
description: The holder consumes Power Herb to skip to the "Next turn" effect of their Move instantly.

name: PP Max
description: Increases Max PP by 1.

name: PP Up
description: Lowers the PP cost of a Move by 1. Does not stack on the same Move.

name: Prism Scale
description: A beautiful rainbow scale that can be used up to evolve Feebas.

name: Protective Pads
description: The holder ignores effects that trigger on Contact when using Moves on targets. A must for collision sports.

name: Protector
description: A stiff, heavy brace that can be used up to evolve Rhydon.

name: Protein
description: Stat Booster. Gives +1 to the user's Athletics and Intensity, but they no longer gain gain skill bonuses at Level 20. Consuming other Stat Booster items stacks at 1 level lower for each.

name: Psychic Seed
description: If the field is Psychic Terrain, is eaten by the holder to Boost SDEF by +5.

name: Quick Ball
description: +6 to capture during the first round of a battle.

name: Quick Claw
description: When attacking, roll d20. On 17+, the holder’s Move gets +1 Priority.

name: Raft
description: An inflatable raft that holds an entire party. Has oars and a hitch for Pokémon to tow.

name: Rare Candy
description: A power-packed candy that instantly Levels-Up Pokémon that eat it.

name: Razor Claw
description:
A hooked nail that can be used up at night to evolve Sneasel.
The holder gets +3 Critical Rate.

name: Razor Fang
description:
A ghastly tooth that can be used up at night to evolve Gligar.
On 19+, the holder's attacks Flinch the target.

name: Reaper Cloth
description: An otherworldy shround that can be used up to evolve Dusclops.

name: Red Card
description: If a character damages but doesn’t KO the holder, the Red Card is used up to switch out the attacker. Imbued with mysterious sports energy.

name: Red Flute
description: Toots a pessimistic doot, curing a character of your choice of Infatuation.

name: Repeat Ball
description: +6 to capture if the user has owned the target’s species before.

name: Revive
description: Cures Fainting and heals 50% HP. A fragment of vitality.

name: Ribbon Sweet
description: Can be used on a Berry or Sweet to change its trigger to: “hit by a Super-Effective Move.”

name: Ride Pager
description: Calls Ride Pokémon you know the number of to help you out. Expected tip: 500₽.

name: Ring Target
description: Helpfully highlights the holder’s weak points and removes their Type Immunities.

name: Rocky Helmet
description: Whenever an attacker makes contact with the holder, the attacker loses 2 Ticks of HP.

name: Room Service
description: In Trick Room, the holder consumes Room Service and drops -5 SPE.

name: Sachet
description: A strong-smelling stinkbag that can be used up to evolve Spritzee.

name: Scope Lens
description: Highlights vulnerabilities to give the holder +4 Critical Rate.

name: Sharp Beak
description: A bird heirloom that gives the holder’s Flying Moves +5 damage.

name: Shed Shell
description: The holder can't be Trapped. A carapace that fits just loosely enough.

name: Shell Bell
description: The holder heals 10% of the damage their Moves deal. Life’s a beach.

name: Shiny Stone
description: Glimmers with a dazzle. Can be used up to evolve Roselia, Togetic, Minccino, or Floette.

name: Short Fuse
description: If the holder is hit by a Fire Move and knows at least one Move that KO’s themself, the holder uses one of those Moves (player's choice) for free at the end of the round.

name: Signature Z-Crystal
description: In addition to typical Z-Crystal use, lets the holder use Z-Moves exclusive to their species.

name: Silk Scarf
description: The holder's Normal Moves get +5 damage. Plain looks good on some.

name: Silver Powder
description: The holder's Bug Moves get +5 damage. A shiny pile of… chitin?

name: Small Treasure
description: Gold leaves, stardust, beach glass. Treasure that’ll buy you a meal.

name: Snowball
description: If the holder takes Ice damage, they use up the Snowball to Boost ATK by +5. Come to snowball fights prepared.

name: Soda Pop
description: Heals 50 HP. “Psycho Soda!”

name: Soft Sand
description: The holder's Ground Moves get +5 damage.

name: Spell Tag
description: The holder's Ghost Moves get +5 damage.

name: Star Sweet
description: If the holder's HP falls below 3 Ticks, they eat the Sweet to get +3 Accuracy.

name: Sticky Barb
description: The holder loses 1 Tick of HP between rounds. Transfers to others when they make Contact with the holder.

name: Strawberry Sweet
description: Can be used on a Berry or Sweet to change its trigger to: HP below 5 Ticks.

name: Style Kit
description: Can spend 1.5× their buying price to craft any Held Item not consumed upon use during Rests. There's always time for fashion.

name: Sun Stone
description: Glows like the midday sky. Can be used up to evolve Gloom, Sunkern, Cottonee, Petilil, and Helioptile.

name: Super Potion
description: Heals 60 HP.

name: Sweet Apple
description: A peculiar, exceptionally sweet apple that can make Applin evolve into Appletun.

name: Tart Apple
description: A peculiar, exceptionally tart apple that can make Applin evolve into Flapple.

name: Teachy TV
description: A bit outdated with Poképedia available, but works great for group entertainment. Promises to never hold relevant information for the players.

name: Technical Kit
description: Can spend 1.5× their buying price to craft Technical Machines and Technical Records during Rests, if a Pokémon the Trainer owns knows the Move. Share knowledge through technology.

name: Technical Machine
description: Teaches a Pokemon a Move. Is not destroyed upon use. Costs $4 × (500 + (500×PP Cost)) to buy from a standard vendor.

name: Technical Record
description: Teaches a Pokemon a Move. Destroyed upon use. Costs $500 + (500×PP Cost) to buy from a standard vendor.

name: Tent
description: A shelter for sleeping outdoors. Can be used up to gain the benefits of a Long Rest during a Short Rest.

name: Terrain Extender
description: The holder’s special Terrains last 2 rounds longer. Primer for the battlefield.

name: Thick Club
description: Marowak gets +10 ATK when holding this.

name: Throat Spray
description: After the holder uses a Sonic Move, they consume Throat Spray to Boost SATK by +5.

name: Thunder Stone
description: Pulses with crackling sparks. Can be used up to evolve Pikachu, Magneton, Eevee, Nosepass, Eelektrik, Charjabug, or Tadbulb.

name: Timer Ball
description: +6 to capture if the battle has lasted 5 rounds or longer.

name: Toxic Orb
description: Badly poisons the holder between rounds.

name: Twisted Spoon
description: The holder's Psychic Moves get +5 damage.

name: Type Gem
description: The holder uses up the Gem when hitting with a damaging Move of the Gem’s Type to get +10 damage.

name: Type Memory
description: Activates RKS System and changes Multi-Attack's Type to the Memory's Type. Acts as a Technical Record for any Move matching the Memory's Type.

name: Type Plate
description: Each Plate has a specific Type. An ancient stone tablet that gives damaging Moves that match its Type +5 damage.

name: Ultra Ball
description: +4 to capture.

name: Up-Grade
description: A disk of minor adjustments to enhance the user experience that can be used up to evolve Porygon.

name: Utility Umbrella
description: Attacks targeting the holder and the holder’s Abilities ignore the presence of Rain or Harsh Sunlight. (Water and Fire damage doesn’t change, Hurricane and Thunder have their regular Accuracy, etc.)

name: Water Stone
description: Sparkles like a sunlit stream. Can be used up to evolve Poliwhirl, Staryu, Shellder, Eevee, Lombre, or Panpour.

name: Weakness Policy
description: If the holder is damaged Super-Effectively, they use up the Weakness Policy to Boost ATK and SATK by +10 each.

name: Weathered Rock
description: When the holder changes the weather, it lasts 2 rounds longer.

name: Whipped Dream
description: A cloyingly-sweet treat that can be used up to evolve Swirlix.

name: White Flute
description: Toots a merry doot. The next wild Pokémon encountered becomes 2 Levels weaker.

name: White Herb
description: If one of the holder's Stats is Dropped below its default, they consume the White Herb to restore all Drops.

name: Wide Lens
description: The holder gets +2 Accuracy.

name: Wild Mushroom
description: Eaten when the user enters battle to roll on the Wild Mushroom table.

name: Wise Glasses
description: The holder’s Special Moves get +5 bonus damage.

name: X Accuracy
description: Boosts Accuracy by +4. Pharmaceutical trademarked as Hits Well.

name: X Attack
description: Boosts ATK by +10. Pharmaceutical trademarked as PlusPower.

name: X Defend
description: Boosts DEF by +10. Pharmaceutical trademarked as Defender.

name: X Sp. Atk
description: Boosts SATK by +10. Pharmaceutical trademarked as Special Up.

name: X Sp. Def
description: Boosts SDEF by +10. Pharmaceutical trademarked as Special Guard.

name: X Speed
description: Boosts SPE by +10. Pharmaceutical trademarked as Speeder.

name: Yellow Flute
description: A clear tone cures a character of your choice of Confusion.

name: Z-Crystal
description: The holder can use Z-Moves matching the Z-Crystal’s type.

name: Z-Ring
description: Trainers wearing this can activate Z-Moves.

name: Zinc
description: Stat Booster. Gives +1 to the user's Stealth and Insight, but they no longer gain gain skill bonuses at Level 20. Consuming other Stat Booster items stacks at 1 level lower for each.

name: Zoom Lens
description: The holder gets +4 Accuracy targeting characters who already acted this Round.

name: Choice Dumpling
description: A dumpling that will make a Pokémon become fixated on a move in battle. The Pokémon will deal more damage when using that move but will take more damage as well.

name: Aux Powerguard
description: An item that sharply boosts the offensive and defensive stats of a Pokémon in battle. These effects disappear if the Pokémon leaves the battle.

name: Swap Snack
description: When eaten, this curious snack temporarily swaps a Pokémon's offensive stats with its defensive stats.

name: Twice-Spiced Radish
description: For the next five turns, the Pokémon takes a hard-hitting stance, which increases damage dealt by its moves (+50%).

name: Ball of Mud
description: A ball of mud that has become stiff and hard. Hitting a Pokémon with one may stun the Pokémon, creating an opening for you to act.

name: Scatter Bang
description: When thrown at the ground, these balls produce a loud noise and scare off low-level Pokémon in the area, sending them running.

name: Smoke Bomb
description: When thrown, a Smoke Bomb creates a cloud of smoke with a wide radius that lingers for approximately 25 seconds. The player can sneak in the smoke like in tall grass, allowing them to sneak up on wild Pokémon without being noticed.

name: Spoiled Apricorn
description: An Apricorn that's had its insides eaten. Hitting a Pokémon with one may stun the Pokémon, creating an opening for you to act.

name: Stealth Spray
description: When used from the satchel, it silences the player's footsteps for one minute, reducing the chance of alerting wild Pokémon.

name: Sticky Glob
description: A ball of some kind of sticky substance. Hitting a Pokémon with one may stun the Pokémon, creating an opening for you to act.

name: Hopo Berry
description: When used from the satchel on a Pokémon, it restores the PP of one of its moves by 10. When thrown from the satchel onto a wild Pokémon, its reactions will be dulled.

name: Cornerstone Mask
description: If an Ogerpon is holding a Cornerstone Mask, it changes to its Cornerstone Mask form. It increases the power of its moves by 20%. An item to be held by Ogerpon. This carved wooden mask is adorned with crystals and allows Ogerpon to wield the Rock type during battle.

name: Teal Mask
description: A teal mask patterned after the face of an ogre. Ogerpon dropped it while fleeing up the stairs after visiting the Festival of Masks.

name: Hearthflame Mask
description: If an Ogerpon is holding a Hearthflame Mask, it changes to its Hearthflame Mask form. It increases the power of its moves by 20%.

name: Wellspring Mask
description: If an Ogerpon is holding a Wellspring Mask, it changes to its Wellspring Mask form. It increases the power of its moves by 20%.

name: Covert Cloak
description: This hooded cloak conceals the holder, tricking the eyes of its enemies and protecting it from the additional effects of moves.

name: Fresh-Start Mochi
description: A mochi cake with Berries kneaded into its dough. It causes a Pokémon to lose all its base points.

name: Leader's Crest
description: A shard of what appears to be an old blade of some sort. It is held only by Bisharp that head up a group of Pawniard.

name: Loaded Dice
description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon. This loaded dice always rolls a good number, and holding one can ensure that the holder's multistrike moves hit more times. Loaded Dice causes multi-strike moves used by the holder to always hit at least four times, if possible.

It causes Triple Kick, Triple Axel, and Population Bomb used by the holder to only perform one accuracy check. It causes the holder's Population Bomb to hit four to ten times (with an even chance of each number of hits).

name: Malicious Armor
description: A cursed set of armor that can make Charcadet evolve into Ceruledge. Malicious will lurks within it.

name: Auspicious Armor
description: A blessed set of armor that can make Charcadet evolve into Armarouge. Auspicious wishes live within it.

name: Unremarkable Teacup
description: Causes Counterfeit Form Poltchageist to evolve into Unremarkable Form Sinistcha upon use. It may be cracked, but tea drunk from it is delicious.

name: Masterpiece Teacup
description: Causes Artisan Form Poltchageist to evolve into Masterpiece Form Sinistcha upon use. It may be chipped, but tea drunk from it is delicious.

name: Mirror Herb
description: Just after an opponent has a stat increase, the holder consumes the Mirror Herb and gets the same stat increase. If multiple stats of the opponent are increased at once, all the stat increases are copied.

name: Punching Glove
description: Punching Glove increases the power of punching moves by 10% and prevents contact with targets done by those moves. This item's effect additionally stacks with Iron Fist.

name: Scroll of Darkness
description: A peculiar scroll that can make a certain species of Pokémon evolve. Written upon it are the true secrets of the path of darkness.

name: Scroll of Waters
description: A peculiar scroll that can make a certain species of Pokémon evolve. Written upon it are the true secrets of the path of water.

name: Tera Shard
description: 50 of these can be used to change a Pokémon’s Tera Type. On rare occasions, these shards form when a Tera Pokémon falls in battle and its Tera Jewel shatters.

name: Syrupy Apple
description: A peculiar, exceptionally syrupy apple that can make Applin evolve into Dipplin.

name: Tera Orb
description: An orb that holds within it the power to crystallize. When it is charged with energy, it can be used to cause Pokémon to Terastallize.

name: Ability Shield
description: This cute and rather unique-looking shield protects the holder from having its Ability changed or suppressed, and protects the holder from effects that ignore Abilities.

name: Booster Energy
description: The energy that fills this capsule boosts the strength of the Pokémon. If held by a Pokémon with the Ability Protosynthesis when harsh sunlight is not active, or Quark Drive when Electric Terrain is not active, Booster Energy activates the Pokémon's Ability (being consumed in the process).

name: Clear Amulet
description: This clear, sparkling amulet protects the holder from having its Stats Dropped by others.
